intro: Scorzonera sylvatica, commonly known as the woodland scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow ray flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its roots are somewhat tuberous and have been historically used in traditional herbal medicine. Scorzonera sylvatica is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
